main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Lewiston, Maine on April 21, 1966, with the observer concluding it was likely a meteor.
interesting points: The object was described as meteor-shaped with a bluish-white front and tail emitting gold colored sparks., The sighting lasted approximately 4 seconds before the object burned out., The observer was riding a motorcycle, which typically creates a lot of noise, but no sound was reported from the object., The sighting was pointed out by a passenger on the motorcycle., The weather was clear during the sighting.
witness description: 2D LT Stanley W. Karol and another observer from Penthouse Apartments, both with excellent reliability.
